intro: Stenanthium sachalinense, commonly known as the Sakhalin false shamrock, is a rare flowering plant native to the Russian Far East. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, trifoliate leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It is notable for its delicate appearance and limited distribution, making it a subject of interest in botanical studies. Due to habitat loss and limited propagation, it is considered endangered in its native range.
